intro: Warneria canadensis, commonly known as the Canadian warneria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Warneria canadensis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
